newsitem.title: FRANCE: Kleinwort may downgrade Eridania stock.
newsitem.headline: Kleinwort may downgrade Eridania stock.

text.p: Kleinwort Benson analyst Charles Manso said he may downgrade his rating on shares of French food group Eridania Beghin-Say because of the potentially negative impact on the company of price negotiations between suppliers of fructose and U.S. soft drink companies.
Kleinwort Benson currently has a "hold" rating on the stock.
"We are turning cautious on the stock because of price negotiations in the fructose sector," he said.
"In all likelihood we are heading for a downgrade. All indications coming from the United States are that those negotiations are going incredibly badly."
Eridania's Cerestar USA unit, formerly American Maize Products, is a big player in the U.S. market for fructose, which is made from corn.
While cheaper corn prices will benefit U.S. sweetener producers this year, extra industry capacity limits their bargaining room in price negotiations with soft drink companies.
"Corn costs came down but unfortunately the outlook for prices is grim," he said.
